main_definition: A cord is a flexible, elongated object typically used as a medium to transmit signals or energy, or it can refer to an agreement between two parties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A thin, flexible string made of twisted fibers
meanings_and_examples.example: I pulled on the old fishing cord to tie my boat's ropes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An agreement or arrangement between two parties
meanings_and_examples.example: We reached a cord with the supplier, agreeing to new terms for our contract.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of cables used together for electrical transmission
meanings_and_examples.example: The power plant has several power cords running through its main building.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A device or mechanism that is part of a larger system, often transmitting signals or energy
meanings_and_examples.example: She plugged in her phone charger cord to charge the battery overnight.
